article_metadata.description: Last week JAMA published a remarkable article that lays out the economics and industry structure of the US health care system. It is very useful to anyone who wants to understand better why US health care costs so much, why the various actors in the system behave as they do, and where current health care reform initiatives may take us. And, it illuminates important facts and fallacies of popular thinking. What follows is a “Cliff’s Notes” treatment, designed to summarize the most interesting facts/conclusions and whet appetites to read the whole thing.
article_metadata.author: Todd Hixon
